Sentencas: In this study, a nanocomposite electrolyte is synthesized using a microwave sintering technique, providing an alternative method and improving the conventional sintering technique.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this paper, samarium doped ceria (SDC) materials are synthesized by the co-precipitation method using carbonates as precipitating agents.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The precursor of SDC-carbonate is sintered in a microwave (MW) oven and conventionally heated in a digital furnace at 900 degrees C. X-ray diffraction (XRD) and scanning electron microscope (SEM) techniques are applied for structural studies.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For electrochemical characterization, four probe conductivity and fuel cell performances are completed.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The materials prepared using MW improved the densification and exhibited excellent sintering during compared to the conventional method of preparation for the same material.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Excellent fuel cell performance (0.65 W cm(-2)) is achieved with microwave sintering.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This method of sintering proves that the microwave process can save time and energy when compared to conventional sintering.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This method can provide significant economic benefits compared to conventional sintered materials for applications in fuel cell technology.
Titulo: Structural and electrochemical studies of microwave sintered nanocomposite electrolytes for solid oxide fuel cells
